Breakfast.title: Chicken Masala
Breakfast.description: Chicken Tikka Masala is a beloved Indian-inspired dish known for its rich, creamy, and flavorful tomato-based curry. It features grilled or pan-seared marinated chicken pieces (tikka) simmered in a spiced, slightly tangy, and aromatic sauce. This dish perfectly balances smoky, spicy, and creamy elements and is often served with naan or basmati rice.
ingredients: 500g boneless chicken (thighs or breast), cut into chunks
1/2 tsp red chili powder (adjust to spice preference)
2 tomatoes, pureed (or 1/2 cup canned tomato puree)
1 tsp paprika or Kashmiri red chili powder (for color)
1/2 cup heavy cream or fresh cream
A pinch of sugar to balance acidity
instructions: Marinate the chicken by mixing yogurt, lemon juice, ginger paste, garlic paste, garam masala, cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, red chili powder, salt, and oil in a bowl.
Add the chicken chunks to the marinade, coat well, cover, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan and cook the marinated chicken on medium heat until browned and cooked through, then set it aside.
In the same pan, heat butter or oil and saut√© the chopped onion until golden brown.
Add ginger paste and garlic paste, cooking for about 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in the pureed tomatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes until the oil separates from the sauce.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, paprika, turmeric powder, garam masala, and salt, and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add the cooked chicken and any juices to the sauce, stirring well to coat the chicken.
Pour in the cream and sprinkle kasuri methi, then simmer for 5 minutes until the sauce thickens.
Taste and adjust salt or spice if needed, adding a pinch of sugar if the sauce is too acidic.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with naan or basmati rice.
Breakfast.author: Ankit2106
